docs.abstract: You can keep an eye on what people are talking about on Twitter even if you prefer to skip the apps and stick to a flip phone or a web browser.
docs.snippet: You can keep an eye on what people are talking about on Twitter even if you prefer to skip the apps and stick to a flip phone or a web browser.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. I do not have a smartphone. Can I still use Twitter? Do I need an account?

docs.abstract: Apple’s Mail program can send and receive messages from multiple accounts, but you can set a preferred address for sending new messages.
docs.snippet: Apple’s Mail program can send and receive messages from multiple accounts, but you can set a preferred address for sending new messages.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. I have multiple accounts set up in the Mac’s default Mail program. I notice sometimes when I create a message, Mail automatically sets the sender address to the account I use for personal correspondence and not my preferred home-business account. How can I specify that my business account should be the default sender address?

headline.main: Picking a Default Account in Mac Mail
headline.print_headline: Choosing a Default Account in Mac Mail

docs.abstract: The most immediate fear: A sharp falloff in bond prices would rattle equity markets that are now trading at record highs.
docs.snippet: The most immediate fear: A sharp falloff in bond prices would rattle equity markets that are now trading at record highs.
docs.lead_paragraph: For nearly a decade, central banks around the world have been the biggest buyers of bonds, sending interest rates plummeting and stock markets soaring.

headline.main: Investors Spooked at Specter of Central Banks Halting Bond-Buying Spree
headline.print_headline: Investors Fear End Of Binge On Bonds

docs.abstract: The suspensions pointed to Beijing’s growing willingness to test forceful antipollution measures and assume a leading role in the fight against climate change.
docs.snippet: The suspensions pointed to Beijing’s growing willingness to test forceful antipollution measures and assume a leading role in the fight against climate change.
docs.lead_paragraph: Want the latest climate news in your inbox? You can sign up here to receive Climate Fwd:, our new email newsletter.

headline.main: China, Moving to Cut Emissions, Halts Production of 500 Car Models
headline.print_headline: China Halts Production Of Cars Seen As Inefficient

docs.abstract: Companies like Starbucks and KFC have prospered in China, but cultural differences and other factors have also led to notable failures.
docs.snippet: Companies like Starbucks and KFC have prospered in China, but cultural differences and other factors have also led to notable failures.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Unilever brought its Rexona deodorant to China a decade ago, dreaming of a market with 2.6 billion armpits.

headline.main: Aiming at China’s Armpits: When Foreign Brands Misfire

docs.abstract: The personal payment platform Zelle is flourishing. But so are fraudsters, who are exploiting weaknesses in the banks’ security.
docs.snippet: The personal payment platform Zelle is flourishing. But so are fraudsters, who are exploiting weaknesses in the banks’ security.
docs.lead_paragraph: Big banks are making it easy to zap money to your friends. Maybe too easy.

headline.main: Zelle, the Banks’ Answer to Venmo, Proves Vulnerable to Fraud

docs.abstract: Big banks, private equity firms and national retailers that have vowed to operate with a social conscience could band together to turn Remington into the model of a modern gun company.
docs.snippet: Big banks, private equity firms and national retailers that have vowed to operate with a social conscience could band together to turn Remington into the model of a modern gun company.
docs.lead_paragraph: Remington Outdoor, one of the country’s oldest and largest gun makers, is getting ready to emerge from bankruptcy.

headline.main: Please, Please Buy This Gun Company
headline.print_headline: Could Wall Street Revamp A Bankrupt Gun Company?

docs.abstract: The latest Edelman Trust Barometer shows consumers expect chief executives to proactively take steps on social issues, even before lawmakers do.
docs.snippet: The latest Edelman Trust Barometer shows consumers expect chief executives to proactively take steps on social issues, even before lawmakers do.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chief executives across the business world are increasingly wading into political issues that were once considered off limits — like gun control and climate change — but they might not be moving fast enough.

headline.main: C.E.O.s Should Lead on Addressing Social Issues, Poll Finds

docs.abstract: A female reporter accused Harold E. Ford Jr., a former congressman, of inappropriate behavior. Morgan Stanley found no proof but fired him. How one Wall Street firm responded to misconduct allegations.
docs.snippet: A female reporter accused Harold E. Ford Jr., a former congressman, of inappropriate behavior. Morgan Stanley found no proof but fired him. How one Wall Street firm responded to misconduct allegations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Late last year, Morgan Stanley got a tip: Reporters were asking about allegations that a high-profile executive, the former congressman Harold E. Ford Jr., had harassed a female journalist.

headline.main: A Wall St. Executive’s Downfall Seemed Sudden. It Was Years in the Making.
headline.print_headline: A Wall Street Executive’s Sudden Downfall Was Years in the Making

byline.original: By Kate Kelly and Andrew Ross Sorkin

docs.abstract: Women still earn far less for every dollar that men earn, but two professors say their research shows no significant difference at the chief executive level.
docs.snippet: Women still earn far less for every dollar that men earn, but two professors say their research shows no significant difference at the chief executive level.
docs.lead_paragraph: The pay gap between men and women has rightly become an important topic of conversation in offices and boardrooms across the country. Despite the efforts of some companies to address the disparity, women last year earned 82 percent of what men earned, according to a Pew Research Center report. The subject was the focus of a “60 Minutes” segment on Sunday night.

headline.main: Gender Pay Gap? Maybe Not in the Corner Office, a Study Shows
headline.print_headline: At the Top, The Pay Gap May Be Gone
